alert.note: Alert for Moffat (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 03 at 6:51PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected along the Yampa River. * WHERE...A portion of the Yampa River through Moffat County, in northwest Colorado. The advisory area includes a stretch of the Yampa from the confluence with the Little Snake River to the confluence with the Green River along the Utah/Colorado state line. * WHEN...From this evening to Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected in low-lying and poor drainage areas. County roads and Park Service roads near the river may be inundated with water. Some low-water crossings may become impassable while river levels/flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 634 PM MDT, gage reports indicated increased river levels/flow due to accelerated snowmelt. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Yampa River - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dinosaur National Monument as well as rural areas of West Central Moffat County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
